section.p: A customer places a new order according to data below. First consider the best way for entering the order. Then create this order. The OrderCode should be the next available order code.
section.codeblock: Order on 23 April 2010, 10 o'clock. Customer Rebecca Smit orders by phone 3 boxes CHER and 2 boxes Marz.
section.p: A few hours later the following change to this order is made by phone. First consider again the best way to handle the change. Then apply the change.
section.codeblock: Order change 23 April 2010, 16 o'clock. The two boxes Marz should be deleted.

section.title: Solution
section.p: First search in table Customers for the CustomerCode of Rebecca Smit. This is 11. Then open form Orders. Navigate to the last order. This order has OrderCode 967. The OrderCode for the new order will therefore be 968. Click button New Record. Enter OrderCode 968, the OrderDate and CustomerCode 11. In the subform at the bottom enter the data for the boxes CHER and MARZ.
To delete the boxes MARZ you open table OrderDetails, navigate to the last order with OrderCode 968. Select the row with MARZ, right mouse click and select Delete Record.
